Boys Hostel - VVIT boys hostel provides well-lit, ventilated rooms with 10 beds per flat, a dedicated mess serving healthy food, 24-hour security, and complimentary transportation to and from college (fee: Rs 90,000 for 2023-24, excluding dhobi charges), located near Kaza Toll Plaza. VVIT's esteemed Principal, Dr. Yennapusa Mallikarjuna Reddy, is a highly qualified and experienced academic leader with a passion for innovation.  He boasts a Ph.D. in Radar Signal and Image Processing, 31 years of teaching experience, and over 30 published research papers.

The department boasts collaborations with leading tech companies like Google and Infosys, and its graduates are placed in top MNCs with lucrative packages. It houses state-of-the-art computing facilities, an industry-sponsored AI/DL lab, and actively encourages research endeavors. The department is committed to fostering innovation and all-round development in its students, with initiatives like Google Developer Clubs and faculty dedicated to their comprehensive growth. Overall, CSE at VVIT aims to produce well-rounded computer science professionals with strong ethical values. To know more visit: https://www.vvitguntur.com/departments/cse-home

patterns: graduate aptitude test for engineers it
responses: The Department of Information Technology (IT) at VVIT has been successfully functioning since 2007, offering a B.Tech (Information Technology) programme with an intake of 180 students.
The IT department at VVIT is provisionally accredited by NBA and has a reputation for uncompromising discipline and flawless execution of academic policies.

The department has strong industry interactions and MOUs with leading technology companies, including Google Code Labs, Infosys (Campus Connect), Microsoft (Campus Agreement), Tech Mahindra, SphereMe, and InetSolv & Vee-Technologies.
The IT department regularly organizes symposia, exhibitions, conferences, seminars, and workshops for students, faculty, research scholars, and industry professionals.

Students from the IT department at VVIT are placed in top MNCs such as Infosys, IBM, Tech Mahindra, Accenture, Mind Tree, Samsung R&D, EPAM, and Deutsche Bank of Singapore, with packages ranging from 2.4 to 9.5 Lacs per annum.
The department features 2 fully air-conditioned computer centres with 120 systems, state-of-the-art computing facilities, and well-equipped modern training facilities.
The IT department encourages innovative research in information technology and aims to deliver quality services to match the needs of the technical education system, industry, and society.
Faculty members of the IT department are dedicated to the comprehensive development of students, encouraging participation in sports, co-curricular, and extracurricular activities.
The IT department also manages the software and hardware requirements of the entire institute and boasts a strong alumni network.
Dr. Kalavathi A is the Professor and Head of the Information Technology Department, with a PhD in Computer Science & Engineering from Acharya Nagarjuna University.

Dr. Kalavathi A has 18 years of teaching experience, has published numerous national and international journals, and is a recipient of the Women Scientist Scholarship from the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India.
Dr. Kalavathi A is a member of professional societies like ACM & CSI, and her research interests include information security, network security, and computer networks.
The vision of the IT department is to produce IT professionals capable of developing globally competitive and socially useful IT solutions and products.

The mission includes producing IT professionals for the global IT industry, developing student-centric and qualitative teaching-learning practices, and establishing cutting-edge technology infrastructure.
The IT department aims to serve the public, state, and nation by building quality engineers and making students the technological ambassadors of VVIT in their future careers.

patterns: academic and research excellence civil engineering
responses: Civil engineering focuses on designing and constructing new facilities such as buildings, bridges, highways, and water treatment plants, as well as analyzing the effects of deterioration, system interdependencies, and life-cycle impacts. Today's civil engineer must consider environmental and economic sustainability.
The undergraduate program at VVIT prepares students with the necessary background in traditional principles and new technologies to address complex, interdisciplinary problems in civil engineering.

Dr. Sreedhar Babu Talluru, M.Tech., Ph.D., is a dedicated Professor in the Department of Civil Engineering at VVIT, with over 26 years of teaching and research experience. He has published technical papers on structural engineering and is actively involved in advanced faculty development programmes and professional societies.
Dr. Sreedhar Babu Talluru has expertise in earthquake risk management and has contributed significantly to the field through special lectures and seminars.

The vision of the Civil Engineering department at VVIT is to produce globally competitive and socially responsible professionals who contribute to nation-building through innovative ideas and quality research.

The mission includes implementing qualitative teaching and learning practices, developing engineers with scientific knowledge to meet fast-changing industry needs, providing hands-on experience, and promoting innovative thinking.
The department aims to cultivate discipline and encourage students to become responsible citizens.

patterns: srinivasa rao tanneeru teaching and research
responses: Mechanical engineering is a core department that spans across various sectors including automobile, electrical, IT, manufacturing, design, military, naval, air force, and research organizations.
The Mechanical Engineering department at VVIT was established in 2011 with an intake of 60 students, which has grown to accommodate 180 students by the academic year 2018-19.

The department boasts fourteen well-equipped laboratories and a faculty team comprising 31 members, including five professors, four associate professors, and a majority of assistant professors, with six faculty members holding doctorates.

Dr. Srinivasa Rao Tanneeru, Ph.D., has over 23 years of teaching and research experience in Mechanical Engineering. He has published extensively in reputed international journals and serves as a member of various professional societies.

Dr. Srinivasa Rao Tanneeru's research interests include Experimental Gas Dynamics, Thermodynamic Analysis, Flow Visualization Studies, and Alternate Fuels for I.C. Engines. He is actively involved in mentoring Ph.D. scholars.
The vision of the Mechanical Engineering department is to impart global knowledge and perspectives, enabling graduates to serve industry and society through quality education and research.

The mission includes fostering technical strength, ethical soundness, communication skills, leadership qualities, and professional skills among students, while promoting overall personality development and social responsibilities.
The department strives to establish strong relationships with industries to expose students to cutting-edge technologies.

patterns: education projects by vasireddy vidya sagar
business acumen of vasireddy vidya sagar
social work by vasireddy vidya sagar
response: Vasireddy Vidya Sagar is a visionary leader with over 20 years of experience in academics and industry. He holds a Bachelor of Engineering degree from Bangalore University and has been actively involved in computer education since 1994. He managed the prestigious Government of Andhra Pradesh 1000 computerisation project, impacting over 75,000 students. As the managing trustee of Social Education Trust, he established Vasireddy Venkatadari Institute of Technology, which is ranked among the top engineering colleges in Andhra Pradesh. He also initiated VIVA - The School, the first International School in Andhra Pradesh, aiming to provide world-class education. Beyond education, he is involved in various ventures including Social Computer Services and Social Agro Industries, contributing to both technological and industrial education. His leadership extends to social welfare through his involvement in cultural organizations and community development projects.

patterns: What are the primary uses of Google CodeLabs?
How are Google CodeLabs funded and maintained?
Can you explain the concept of Google CodeLabs?
responses: Google CodeLabs are state-of-the-art computer labs optimized for group work and mobile development, installed at select college campuses across India. They are designed to promote product/application development and serve as an incentive for host universities to participate in Google's training programs. The labs will be installed at 2 college campuses as part of a skilling initiative funded entirely by Google, including maintenance and IT support. At the end of the initiative, the CodeLabs space and equipment will remain the property of the host college/university.

The primary use of Google CodeLabs is to host Google's curriculum on Machine Learning, AI, Mobile Development, Web Development, Cloud/Analytics, and IoT. They also facilitate train-the-trainer sessions for this curriculum. Additionally, they are open for use by the college as regular computer labs, with Google reserving the right to use them for special programming such as hackathons, GDG/WTM meetups, faculty refresh courses, short programming workshops, design workshops in partnership with UIF, event live-stream viewing parties, and Launchpad startup events. Distinguished speakers from industry/academia may also host speaker series, with hands-on curriculum developed based on their talks.

Google CodeLabs are facilities provided by Google to support product/application development and training programs at select college campuses. They are fully funded by Google, including maintenance and IT support, and will remain the property of the host college/university at the end of the skilling initiative.

University Innovation Fellows (UIF) is a program that empowers students to become agents of change in their universities and communities. Fellows undergo a 6-week training program and work on design challenges to promote innovation and entrepreneurship. The program is designed to foster leadership and creativity among students.

UIF stands for University Innovation Fellows, a program that aims to foster innovation and entrepreneurship in universities. Fellows are trained to design and implement projects that promote positive change in their institutions and communities. The program emphasizes hands-on learning and collaboration.

The University Innovation Fellows program is a prestigious initiative that selects students to undergo training at the Hasso Plattner Design School at Stanford University. Fellows then work on design challenges to promote innovation and entrepreneurship in their universities and communities. The program aims to cultivate a culture of innovation and leadership.

University Innovation Fellows is a program that trains students to become leaders of innovation and entrepreneurship in their universities and communities. Fellows undergo a rigorous 6-week training program and work on design challenges to create positive impact. The program focuses on equipping students with the skills and mindset needed to drive change and innovation.

patterns: How do I get to VVIT
responses: VVIT operates a fleet of 67 buses to provide smooth and glitch-free transportation for students and staff from various locations including Guntur, Vijayawada, Mangalagiri, Tenali, Ponnur, Amaravathi, Tadikonda, Kantheru, Perecherla, Nuthakki, and Pedhanandhipadu.

VVIT offers a comprehensive transportation system with 67 buses covering key locations in Guntur, Vijayawada, Mangalagiri, Tenali, Ponnur, Amaravathi, Tadikonda, Kantheru, Perecherla, Nuthakki, and Pedhanandhipadu, ensuring easy access for students and staff.

VVIT's transport fleet consists of 67 buses that connect the institution to various parts of Guntur, Vijayawada, Mangalagiri, Tenali, Ponnur, Amaravathi, Tadikonda, Kantheru, Perecherla, Nuthakki, and Pedhanandhipadu, providing a convenient commute for students and staff.

VVIT provides an efficient transportation system with 67 buses operating on various routes, including Guntur, Vijayawada, Mangalagiri, Tenali, Ponnur, Amaravathi, Tadikonda, Kantheru, Perecherla, Nuthakki, and Pedhanandhipadu, to facilitate easy travel for students and staff.

patterns: IUCEE-EWB at Vasireddy Venkatadri Institute of Technology
responses: Vasireddy Venkatadri Institute of Technology has launched the IUCEE-EWB Student Chapter, aiming to advance projects that benefit socio-economic causes. The chapter envisions fostering a research mindset and empathy among students to ensure mutual growth.

The IUCEE-EWB Student Chapter at VVIT was inaugurated by our Chairman, Sri Vasireddy Vidhyasagar Garu, with a vision to guide students and professionals in solving real-time community problems using technology-based solutions.
The EWB Student Wing of VVIT, launched by Dr. Showkath Ali, aims to facilitate research, leadership, and competition among students, while promoting societal welfare and valuing diverse opinions.

IUCEE-EWB Student Chapter at VVIT works towards guiding and motivating students to solve community problems using technology, collaborating with non-profit organizations to improve the quality of life for common people.

The IUCEE-EWB chapter at VVIT envisions a future of mutual growth by developing empathy and industry-standard skills among students, with a mission to collaborate with social organizations and understand community problems.

patterns: Role of SAC in student welfare
Hostel and Mess facilities managed by SAC
Infrastructure and campus amenities by SAC
responses: SAC (Student Activities Council) is the official student representative body of VVIT, aiming to represent students' voices, manage student welfare, and facilitate co-curricular activities.
The mission of SAC is to provide excellent services, programs, and facilities for the VVIT family, while its vision is to create dynamic individuals who can bring positive change globally.
SAC's objectives include representing students, managing student welfare, and facilitating co-curricular activities, with a hierarchical structure comprising CWC, Executive Body, and General Body.

CWC (Central Working Committee) is the core organizing body of SAC, responsible for planning, executing, and governing SAC's functionality, with roles like President, Vice-President, and General Secretary.
Executive Body represents specific functionalities, agendas, and activities of SAC, while General Body comprises all VVIT students who can provide feedback and suggestions for betterment.
SAC values students as its central focus, honesty, integrity, and professionalism, and offers opportunities for students to develop social, leadership, and organizational skills.
SAC strives to serve the campus, remain committed to VVIT's mission, and offer a collaborative work environment among departments.

patterns: What is the SAC selection procedure?
Lights camera action in SAC selections
Selection criteria for CWC in SAC
responses: The SAC (Student Activities Council) selections at VVIT follow a rigorous set of criteria including academic standing, disciplinary record, and attendance requirements.
Applicants must submit a detailed application form containing personal details, academic performance, hobbies, and reasons for joining SAC.
Selections are conducted in multiple stages: Resume submission, Brainstorming activities, Lights camera action (Advertisement creation), and Personal Interview.
For CWC selection, emphasis is placed on dedication, creative thinking, leadership qualities, teamwork, and effective communication skills.
The procedure involves initial resume screening followed by team-based activities and a structured interview to assess candidates' suitability for SAC roles.

Students at VVIT can join clubs like Theatre Club, Animation and Graphics Club, Dance Club, Literary Appreciation Club, Movie Appreciation Club, Music Club, Chairman's Club, Photography Club, Political and Social Awareness Club, Yoga and Meditation Club, Painting Club, Martial Arts Club, Sports Club, Robotics Club, Telugu Appreciation Club, Green Club, and Culinary Club to develop new skills and hobbies.

Clubs at VVIT offer a platform for students to showcase their talents and interests, with options like Theatre Club, Animation and Graphics Club, Dance Club, Literary Appreciation Club, Movie Appreciation Club, Music Club, Chairman's Club, Photography Club, Political and Social Awareness Club, Yoga and Meditation Club, Painting Club, Martial Arts Club, Sports Club, Robotics Club, Telugu Appreciation Club, Green Club, and Culinary Club.

patterns: Who are the NCC officers at VVIT?
responses: The National Cadet Corps (NCC) is a Tri-Services Organization in India, nurturing disciplined and patriotic citizens among school and college students on a voluntary basis.
NCC provides basic military training in small arms and parades across Army, Navy, and Air Force cadet units.
NCC cadets, upon completion of their course, enjoy preference over normal candidates in various selections due to their achievements within the corps.
NCC activities at VVIT encompass camps, certificate examinations, and community service initiatives, fostering leadership and teamwork skills among cadets.
NCC intake at VVIT is conducted on a voluntary basis, with a sanctioned strength of 50 cadets annually.
NCC officers at VVIT include Lt. Syed Beeban Basha and Lt. Alla Srivani, who lead and guide the cadets in their training and activities.
The summary of NCC activities includes annual camps, enrollment statistics, and achievements in certificate examinations, aiming to develop well-rounded cadets.
NCC officers like Lt. Syed Beeban Basha and Lt. Alla Srivani at VVIT oversee the training, activities, and growth of NCC cadets, ensuring a disciplined and enriching experience.

patterns: Role of NSS programme officer at VVIT
responses: NSS (National Service Scheme) is a government-sponsored program under the Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports, launched in 1969 during Gandhiji's Birth Centenary Year. It focuses on personality development through community service.
NSS is spread across 298 Universities and 42 (+2) Senior Secondary Councils in India, involving over 3.2 million student volunteers in various community service activities.
The primary objectives of NSS include developing student personalities through community service, fostering social responsibility, and instilling values of empathy and service among volunteers.
NSS activities at VVIT encompass a wide range of initiatives such as community service projects, blood donation camps, health check-ups, and awareness programs on hygiene and education.
NSS events at VVIT can be accessed through the JNTU website using the college NSS unit code 90214706, with detailed archives available for recent years such as 2022-23, 2021-22, and 2019-20.

Mr. I.Luke John Baktha Singh serves as the NSS Programme Officer at VVIT, responsible for organizing and overseeing various NSS activities, events, and initiatives aimed at community development and student engagement.
VVIT students have achieved notable success in JNTUK sports events, participating in various tournaments across different sports and securing commendable results.
VVIT boasts a strong track record in sports, with achievements spanning across disciplines like basketball, kho-kho, volleyball, and athletics at regional and state levels.
VVIT's Physical Education Department is committed to promoting fitness and sportsmanship among students, offering comprehensive facilities and programs.
The sports facilities at VVIT include well-maintained courts, fields, and equipment, supporting a variety of sports activities and events throughout the academic year.
Dr. Arun Kumar Nutalapati, Asst. Professor and Director of Physical Education at VVIT, holds a Ph.D. in Basketball and has contributed significantly to sports development at the college.

Mr. Giridhar Mallela, Asst. Professor and Director of Physical Education at VVIT, brings a wealth of experience in sports management and physical education, enhancing the sports culture at the college.
VVIT provides extensive sports infrastructure including courts, fields, and gyms, fostering a conducive environment for students to excel in sports and games.
The sports facilities at VVIT cater to a wide range of activities, promoting physical fitness and competitive spirit among students through regular sports events and tournaments.
At VVIT, sports activities are integral to student life, encompassing a diverse range of games and events that contribute to holistic development and well-being.

patterns: do we have to wear uniform
responses: VVIT has a specific dress code where students are required to wear formal attire from Monday to Thursday and Saturady. On Fridays, students can wear casual dress.

responses:
There are several committees at VVIT that cater to different aspects of student life and governance. Some of the key committees include:

3. Cultural Committee
4. Sports Committee
5. Placement Committee
6. Discipline Committee
7. Grievance Redressal Committee

Each committee plays a crucial role in enhancing various facets of college life and ensuring smooth functioning of academic, administrative, and extracurricular activities.
